sourcesContent:
import React, { useRef, useState } from 'react' import { useWebGL } from './useWebGL' // Make sure this path is correct import XYGrid from './Geometries/XY-Grid' import Cube from './Geometries/Cube' import Sphere from './Geometries/Sphere' const CANVAS_WIDTH = 512 const CANVAS_HEIGHT = 512 const Sandbox = () => { const canvasRef = useRef(null) const [settings, setSettings] = useState({ useWireframe: false, showCube: false, showXYGrid: true, showSphere: false, scale: 1, rotation: 0, translation: 0 }) const objectsToDraw = [ settings.showXYGrid && new XYGrid(), settings.showCube && new Cube(1), settings.showSphere && new Sphere() ].filter(Boolean) // Filter out falsy values (null, false, undefined) useWebGL(canvasRef, settings, objectsToDraw) const toggleSetting = key => setSettings({ ...settings, [key]: !settings[key] }) return (

The sandbox scene is where you can demonstrate features/capabilities of your library.

setSettings({ ...settings, scale: parseFloat(e.target.value) })} /> setSettings({ ...settings, rotation: parseFloat(e.target.value) })} /> setSettings({ ...settings, translation: parseFloat(e.target.value) })} />
) } export default Sandbox
